intro: Galianthe parvula, commonly known as the small galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained, sandy soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a shaded or partially shaded garden setting. Galianthe parvula is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
